choices.D: FortiGate provides statistics and reading based on historical traffic logs.
choices.B: This traffic shaper drops traffic that exceeds the set limits.
choices.A: The debug output shows per-IP shaper values and real-time readings.
choices.C: Traffic being controlled by the traffic shaper is under 1 Kbps.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
AB refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 134

Selected Answer: C
From the SD-WAN 6.4 Study Guide Page 131

""You need to have an IPv4 policy with web filter for this setup to work."

comments.content: is this dump useful to take SD-WAN 7.0?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 131

choices.C: The web filter profile must be enabled on the firewall policy.
choices.D: The application control profile must be enabled on the firewall policy.
choices.B: The shaper mode must be applied per-IP shaper on the traffic shaping policy.
choices.A: The URL category must be specified on the traffic shaping policy.

choices.B: Matched traffic failed RPF and was caught by the rule.
choices.D: An absolute SD-WAN rule was defined and matched traffic.
choices.A: Traffic has matched none of the FortiGate policy routes.
choices.C: The FIB lookup resolved interface was the SD-WAN interface.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
AC refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 89

"default" SD-WAN minimum configuration
I thing that C and D are correct. A. policy ROUTE no policy rule...

questions.question_text: In the default SD-WAN minimum configuration, which two statements are correct when traffic matches the default implicit SD-WAN rule? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The packets are not denied, they are dropped. Answer D
In a per-IP shaper configuration, if an IP address exceeds the configured concurrent session limit, the message " Denied by quota check" appears.

Selected Answer: A
A refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 137

choices.A: Packets exceeding the configured maximum concurrent connection limit are denied by the per-IP shaper.
choices.C: The packet exceeded the configured maximum bandwidth and was dropped by the shared shaper.
choices.D: Packets exceeding the configured concurrent connection limit are dropped based on the priority configuration.
choices.B: The packet exceeded the configured bandwidth and was dropped based on the priority configuration.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

FortiGate has multiple dial-up VPN interfaces incoming on port1 that match only FIRST_VPN.
Which two configuration changes must be made to both IPsec VPN interfaces to allow incoming connections to match all possible IPsec dial-up interfaces?
(Choose two.)

discussion.content: Less reading, more doing. Been building ADVPN's and dialup VPN's for 3 years now, C is WRONG. aggressive mode is a PCI failure and is NOT required, and I've never used it, ever. Setting a unique peer ID will work, I havent done it but a peer of mine did, but for SURE setting a different DH group and different proposals DOES WORK, so the question is badly written. So I think this is a case where examtopics had it corret, D & B.

Selected Answer: AC
AC refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 182

Selected Answer: AC
AC refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 182

Selected Answer: AC
Answer A and C
I think correct answer is A,C

choices.A: Specify a unique peer ID for each dial-up VPN interface.
choices.C: Configure the IKE mode to be aggressive mode.
choices.D: Use unique Diffie Hellman groups on each VPN interface.
choices.B: Use different proposals are used between the interfaces.
